message: Changed Linux packaging script to executable.
Version number in Linux packaging script is now extracted from CMakeCache.txt (via @peastman).
Added first drafts of OS X build and packaging scripts.
Updated build script for packaging with Linux.
Minor fix to build script for automated packaging.
Fixed python path for automated build script.
Added miniconda/bin to path for automated build scripts.
Updated OSX build/package scripts for Jenkins.
More updates to OS X Jenkins build script.
Updated Jenkins build scripts to also build docs.
Fixed some path errors with Jenkins build scripts  and added preparation scripts.
Minor updates to Jenkins prepare scripts.
Fixed fftw3f library path error in OS X Jenkins build script.
Added relative workspace path to Jenkins build prepare scripts.
Tried to fix Jenkins build script Mac autodetection of version number.
Fixing more paths in Jenkins build paths.
Hopefully fixed issue with Jenkins linux build script.
Fixed a bug in neighbor list construction
CustomIntegrator  throws an exception if variable names are ambiguous
Fix byte handling to work for both Py2 and Py3

Add a basic DCD file test. There's no DCD file _reader_  so without MDTraj we can't validate the that this object does anything more than simply write without exceptions (i.e.  we can't tell if the DCD file is actually _valid_)
Use tempfile to make a file.
Make sure the DCD file handle is closed -- do it the right way in the test.
Remove what appears to be a debug message.
Recognize more residue labels as water in the Amber file parser.
Reduce the water labels down to just the EP models  since that's where it is most important and we don't want false positives.
Copy testInstallation.py to the simtk package and make it an import-safe module. Also copy the test PDB file to the data/ directory  since we rather need it...
Delete all of the code from testInstallation.py and instead replace it with an import of the new testInstallation module and a command to run the tests.

Apparently "from XXX import *" is only allowed at the module level (I get a SyntaxWarning otherwise). So move those imports back to the module level and save any error messages for when the tests are actually run (if ever).
Updated instructions on running the test installation script
Add docstring to test function. Convert all raised exceptions raised in run_tests to TestingError so users only ever have one exception to catch.
Prevent running tests on unsupported CPUs
Workaround for compiler bug in Visual Studio
